content.description: Start on wide left and right holds combo with heels. Move to several smooth shallow sloped jugs on lip. Traverse to the right and top out towards the other end of the short cave? This should be the original route but I feel like it makes perfect sense to just top out straight up, perhaps at a slightly softer grade V4.
content.protection: pads. Might want at least 2 depending on confidence and spotter availability to move pads.
content.location: North west face of Split Boulder. Go through split alley and problem is on immediate left on downhill side.

content.description: Surprisingly interesting movement up a blunt arete. Trust your hands and feet up decent but not perfect holds. The business is over before you are too high up.
content.location: This is at the entrance/exit of the corridor between the heart boulder and the serenity boulder. Look for the arete on the heart boulder that’s on the trail that leads towards ozzy.

content.description:
Link to Beta(Credit to Cory Brewer): vimeo.com/236518358

 Timestamp: 1:34- 2:23 Climber: Carson Taylor
content.location: Near Hoop Dreams

content.description: starts in small cave behind the tesseract boulder on obvious shelf. travers out to sloper then bump to crimp. get left on pinch then top out.
content.location: tesseract boulder

content.description: Start same holds as Tesseract(undercling on left and bad crimp on right). Hit left crimp then go right, following up the crack face. Once you get to the jug that is at the same height as the third move of Tesseract, traverse off right.
content.location: Near Tesseract.

content.description:
sit start with a small left hand sidepull(two fingers) and a crimpy right hand. Go up to a left hand sharp crimp then to a huge jug. Finish above the diagonal crack and traverse right.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dqmFclVJ-ck&t=24s
content.location: Near Trip and Chalky nightmares

content.description: this is an extension of the Trip (v5). this problem starts on sloper in back of cave then goes to a right crimpy gaston then a left crossover to a very large crimp. the route then finishes the same as the trip
content.location: tesseract

content.description:
Sit start with right on block and left on triangular undercling sidepull with feet out and left on sloping ledge just above petestal.

 Link to Beta(credit to Cory Brewer):

vimeo.com/236518358

 Timestamp: 6:34-7:19 Climber: Carson Taylor
content.location: Next to The Unnamed

content.description:
Same start as Shapeshift. Climb up skull teeth holds.

 Link to Beta(credit to Cory Brewer): vimeo.com/236518358

 Timestamp: 2:27-3:10
content.location: To the right of ShapeShifter on Beef It Boulder.

content.description: SDS. Move up to a horrible crimp, then throw for the top. Top out.
content.location: Just to the right of Snake Eyes.

content.description: SDS on low, good holds. Move up to a pocket (snake eye?) and then gun for the top. Top out.
content.location: Located on the opposite side of the Heart Wall. The three snake problems are the first you will see upon entering the boulder area.

content.description:
Squat start with hands in grooves. Throw left to slopey shelf then work your way up to the bomber pocket and top out. Crux is getting a good enough hold with the right hand on a wide pinch feature so you can get your left hand up past the shelf.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f_vuKVWzvXY
content.location: Just down the hill West of the Heart Wall on the NW side of the large boulder. (Just around the corner from the Beef It/Peel It wall.

content.description: Start on large sidepull/undercling. Move straight up crimpy face. Right side of arete is off. Top out.
content.location: Just to the right of Shape Shifter.

content.description:
One of the classics at MRP. Stand start on jug flake. Climb up the 45 degree climb.

 Link to Beta: vimeo.com/161480542

 Video Credit: Cory Brewer Climber: Carson Taylor
content.location: Near Tesseract Boulder

content.description:
This is a low start from the iconic line "Serenity Now", put up by Ben Burkhalter in 2018.

 Match on crimp flake and move left to hard crimp. Place right heel on start hold to cross over right to the left crimp flake. Continue up the route and finish up on "Serenity Now".

 Link to Beta:

instagram.com/p/BtUGT1RH9vg/
content.location: On Tesseract Boulder

content.description:
Start inside the cave with left heel hook. Move outside the cave on slopers for top mossy top out.

 Link to Beta: youtube.com/watch?v=P9oO6ie…
content.location: Near Benito Sanchez.

content.description:
Easy face climbing leads to good holds on a roof, then a slightly committing mantle top out. Great climb to push the V0-V1 climber. 

 There’s no names for this anywhere, and is simply called “V0” in the guidebook. Let me know if anyone has anything to call this (somewhat) worthwhile climb.
content.location: The far right arete of the 4th of July roof. This route lies directly on the main path towards the Ozzy area.

content.description:
Start with two underclings. move into a left hand side pull. move right hand up on sloping hold. utilize a heel hook and work tricky moves to the jug finish hold just above the lip.

 ​Beta Video​​​
content.location: inbetween Shapeshifter and Beef it. uses the sloping arete hold from shapeshifter

content.description: Boulder through a series of uncomfortable sidepulls and a left hand sloper that brings you to a low percentage move involving a left hand throw/ fall back to a finger slot, hold the barn door and finish with improving holds to the top.
content.location: Overhanging Arete to your left as you enter the big tunnel/cave that's front of the 'No Sack' boulder

content.description: SDS on two jugs. Move left to a sloper, then up to another. Top out.
content.location: To the left of Snake Eyes.

content.description: Climb large crack; Top out.
content.location: Located just around the corner from the Heart Wall. Between Left Ventricle and the snake problems.

content.description:
Labeled as "Unnamed #34" in the printable topo. Start on sloper, move right to crimpers, top out.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xAoUKy2u_s0
content.protection: One pad positioned diagonally or, two should cover it
content.location: When you first walk in, the boulder on the right where Shape Shifter is located. At the far end of the boulder, past Beef It.

content.description: Sit start on weird hold(s) on orange-ish arete. Move up on a few crimps and optional highball top out (trend towards the huge crack and tree).
content.protection: One pad. If you top out extra pads won't add much unless you have several.
content.location: Arete immediately right upon exiting the split boulder alley headed downhill.

content.description: Starts low with slot for right and left hand.  Move to sloper with right and left hand to a crimp/sloper.  Move to X sloper and top out.
content.location: First route left of Fourth of July.

content.description: This fantastic route starts on a decent hold, long move to a ledge, and then a committing mantle crux top out. Top probably needs some brushing.
content.protection: At least 2 pads and a spotter or 2. There is a sloped boulder right below this climb and just make sure nobody’s head hits that.
content.location: Starts on a good hold right below a squared ledge. To the left of “No Sack.”

content.description: Start on matched jugs. Move over to a sloper and then move right across Beef It on some more slopers to a final long move to some good holds 8ft right of Beef It mantle. Mantle to top it out.
content.location: Start on Peel It.

content.description: Sit start on left crimp sidepull and right-hand crimp.  Dyno up and catch a toe lock with a right foot in order not to barn door.  Get set up on a huge flake and dyno again to a 3 finger(jug, pocket, sidepull...nothing describes it)  Traverse right to finish
content.location: to the right of Chalky Nightmares

content.description: Crimpy incline up to jug.
content.location: On the arete where the Heart problem is located.

content.description: The stand start to Tesseract.

The V3 route is left to right.  Straightforward first 10 feet, then hand-over-hand on thin rails and key toeholds to two long reaches on thin feet.  The rest is cruising and burning. 

  This traverse can be worked right to left as well.  I would guess it goes at a V2 (though I've never heard a definite rating) with all crux moves in the final 15 feet.
content.location: Entire south face of the boulder between Ozzy and the Grassman Area.

content.description:
Start on matched hands on loaf. Reach out with your right hand to flat sidepull. Then go left hand to bad sloper on arete. Hold this, then go right hand to bad sloper to finish up.

 Link to Beta: youtube.com/watch?v=grlDmp6…

 Credit to: Geoffrey Collawn Climber: Carson Taylor
content.location: Hoop Dreams Boulder

content.description: Stand start on decent ledge then find fun beta to work up more decent ledges. Top out is super mossy but the holds you need are clean. Try not to disturb the moss.
content.location: Leftmost route on the Hoop Dreams boulder. Stand starts on obvious arete.

content.description: One of the best known problems. SDS, Pumpy and on an incline, there's lots of ways to do this one.
content.location: Pretty much the first problem you see when you come in. It'll be on your left and has an incline of about 35 degrees.

content.description:
Interesting mantle with some high-stepping action.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eUBecSCWtws
content.protection: Several pads....lot's of things to hurt you below.
content.location: 4th is on The Grass Man boulder....it's the obvious roof.

content.description: Start in small cave and make long, precise move to small crimp...a couple more thin moves and then its jugs to the top. Not too hard but very low percentage.
content.location: 25-30 ft downhill past Benito Sanchez on the right.

content.description: Start on large, sloping dish to the right of Benito Sanchez. Traverse right using delicate holds on face to large jug about 10 ft to the right of dish. There are lots of variations and eliminates to make for a fun challenge.
content.location: Right of Benito Sanchez

content.description: Start in the back of small roof, make a few moves to the left to set up for long left hand move to shallow dish then stay tight to bring right hand to sloper past the lip of roof. Top it out.
Sit start in the middle of overhang. Long moves directly up to lip. Mantle on available slopers.
content.location: Middle of the overhang of the Shape Shifter Boulder. Between Peel it and Shapeshifter. Boulder is the first boulder to the right of the main trail leading in. Downhill terrain makes the boulder appear short from the backside which faces the trail.

content.description: You sit start on a sloping edge and then a bad right crimp. Go up the small crimps up a slab to mantle.
content.location: To the left of Peel It.

content.description: This is the front "half" of MRP--lot's of classics!
